org.eodisp.core.sm.service
Class ExperimentTask

java.lang.Object
  org.eodisp.core.sm.service.ExperimentTask

final class ExperimentTask
extends java.lang.Object

This is a single task that is able to execute an experiment. Such a task will be created and managed by a ExperimentTaskManager. It has a reference to a single AcquiredExperiment, from which it will take information about the experiment.

In general, an experiment consists of the following parts: 

 Experiment 
     |
     | (one or more)
     -- Federation Execution
                |
                | (one or more)
                -- Federates 
                       |
                       | ( one ore more)
                       -- init data
The exact information of how a specific experiment looks like is stored in the model of the simulation manager application. This information will be queried to construct an appropriate AcquiredExperiment object. An object is created in order to have a 'snapshot' of the experiment at the moment it is acquired. This enables the user to work on the experiment even if the experiment is running. However, parameters of a running cannot be changed.

An experiment task can execute the following upon an experiment (this is what an EODiSP experiment supports)

  • acquire: This will prepare an experiment in order to be ready to get executed. This method contacts all model manager application involved to lock the federate(s) that will be used in the experiment. Additionally, it creates a SOM file for every federation execution. This file is stored on the file system and will be used later to start the control federate.
  • start: This actually starts the experiment. It starts one federation execution at the time, one after the other. Starting a federation execution means to first start the control federate for this federation and then to contact each model manager involved in order to start the federates included in the federation execution. After starting all of these components, the federation will run by itself, without any further interactions.
  • pause: This will issue the EODISP_PAUSE synchronization point.
  • step: This will issue the EODISP_STEP synchronization point.
  • resume: This will issue the EODISP_RESUME synchronization point.
  • cancel: This cancels the experiment. This can be used at any time and will cleanup all resources. If the experiment is already running, it will stop it.
Threads
A separate thread is created for the following tasks performed by this class.
  • acquiring the experiment
  • starting/running the experiment
  • starting/running the control federate
States
Because there are several parties involved in running an experiment, several states are used to control (or monitor) the runtime behaviour of the experiment. All these states are reported in a separated object of type ExperimentTaskState. One such state object will be created for each experiment. The following states will be recorded in this state object
  • The state of the experiment itself (see ExperimentTaskState.TaskState),
  • the state of the control federate (see ExperimentTaskState.ControlFederateState), and
  • the state of the federation execution (FederationState)

In respect of the possible functionality of a experiment task, the following should illustrate the dependencies (or preconditions) between the states and the functionality possible in the states. 

 Legend: TS=Task State, CS=Control Federate State, FS=Federation State
 
 acquire: 
     TS: STOPPED
     CS: STOPPED
     FS: NOT_INITIALIZED
     
 start: 
     TS: PREPARED
     CS: STOPPED
     FS: NOT_INITIALIZED
     
 pause: 
     TS: STARTED
     CS: STARTED
     FS: STARTED (this will be enforced by the control federate)
     
 step: 
     TS: STARTED
     CS: STARTED
     FS: PAUSED (this will be enforced by the control federate)
     
 resume: 
     TS: STARTED
     CS: STARTED
     FS: PAUSED (this will be enforced by the control federate)
     
 cancel: 
     TS: any but not STOPPED
     CS: any
     FS: any
Visibility
Methods declared in this class have all a package private visibility. Public methods are declare in the ExperimentTaskManager class.

Version:

eglimi

reset

void reset()
Resets the experiment if it is not in ExperimentTaskState.TaskState.END state. It does the same as cancel().
